How it's possible? As for me it's violates https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/_Permissions

fields.description:
In the application I'm working on, we use the repository's UUID to identify the repository. That way, even if its ownership is transferred or the description changes (thus altering the slug) we'll still be pointed at the same repository. Currently the POST hook doesn't respond with the UUID, which makes it hard to match the POST data to the repository in our database.

Is that something that can be added?
fields.summary: Include repository UUID in POST hook payload (BB-11639)

fields.description:
When a user pushes a commit that has a commit message that contains a date in the form, YYYYMMDD (e.g. 20141201), Bitbucket converts that date into a link to a commit. If a commit with that ID does not happen to exist (which is usually the case), the link will be a broken link.

Refer to the attached screenshot for an example.
fields.summary: Commits page converts dates into broken links (BB-11618)

fields.description:
Hi Support,

I signed up for a new account. Upon completion, I got this message:\\
Your account has been disabled.\\
We're sorry. Your account has been flagged by our automated system for possible violation of our terms of service. If this is an error, please contact Bitbucket Support to have it reinstated.

My username is tonyfun73, thanks for helping me with this issue.

fields.description:
I'm not sure what syntax is actually being used, but a file named .zshrc should be highlighted like a shell file, and it's instead highlighting dollar signs in red as errors.

Example here: https://bitbucket.org/kevinburke/small-dotfiles/src/6d1529e92f70717ed545b47f68a3400a6b4db762/.zshrc?at=master#cl-4
fields.summary: Incorrect syntax highlighting for .zshrc (BB-11605)

fields.description:
Sometimes I will be looking at a diff between branches and I will want to leave a comment on the code. However, I am unable to do so! I can only leave comments if I am on a diff for a commit.

It's annoying that I can't write comments from the branch diff. It means I have to take the time to find out which commit in the branch the code change I'm looking at, then find that line of code again, then write my comment.

When I'm doing a code review of a branch with a bunch of commits, I want to look at the branch diff page and leave comments on the changes. Bitbucket's code should automatically detect which commit and my comment belongs to and add it there. And show the comments on the branch diff. Right now, comments can only be created from the Commit Diff, not the Branch Diff.
fields.summary: Comment on Commit while in Branch Diff View (BB-11607)

fields.description:
The Side by Side File Diff view is great. But it only lets me see it as a "dialog" in the same window as the commit/branch diff. It should let me open it in a new tab.

If you try to open it in a new tab it doesn't work! The new tab is the same page but without the dialog. The new tab should have that "Side-By-Side" dialog open. Or be a Side-By-Side page rather than a dialog of another page.
fields.summary: Side-By-Side (file diff) View, Open in New Tab (BB-11609)

fields.description: When a repo is named addon, some links are not built correctly when displaying the sidebar, and in addition some links are broken.
fields.summary: Repositories with the name addon break relative links in the sidebar (BB-11603)

fields.description:
It would be very useful to see who has las updated the issue in the issues list view by adding additional column

right now it has:

* Title
* Status
* Votes
* Assignee
* Version
* Created
* Updated

adding "Updated by" would be most useful.
fields.summary: Last modified by in the issues view

Thank you.

Please fail the tag enumeration more gracefully, to allow the other important features of the page to be accessible.

fields.description:
I have the following problem with all my bitbucket repositories.

All works fine until I ssh access my server from shell (from another terminal window). That one asks me password to enter Keychain.\\
After I enter the password git brakes down and I'm getting the following message:

{code}
#!sh

conq: repository access denied.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

Nothing works except restart or log out and back login works just fine as well.

Also, how do I fix this?

I would really like the ability to be able to search a file name in the commit search box.

Some that still work include :hankey: and :angry:

This is what it looks like on the above page:

!434737046-emoji.png|thumbnail!

fields.description: I recently forked a repository to a newly created team. After switching the members of the team over to the repository, every time that we create a new pull request for a feature branch to default, it defaults to the default on the original repository, not the teams repository
fields.summary: Forked a repo to a team, now all new pull requests default to the original repo

fields.description: In our organization, we use separate branches of our central repository for use by different teams.  Consequently, when a teammate sets up to receive notifications against the repository, they end up getting "spammed" with many irrelevant notifications.  We would very much like the ability to create a monitor for activity isolated to specific branches.
fields.summary: Branch Level Monitoring (BB-11588)

fields.description:
I can't open an Atlassian support ticket because...

I can't log in because...

I can't verify my email address because...

The system isn't sending me a (re)verification email. This has been going on for a week now, and I see several other users have the same problem.
fields.summary: Can't open Atlassian support tickets

fields.description:
I would like to link to and highlight a block of code as opposed to a single line. Example:\\
https://bitbucket.org/[user]/[repo]/src/tip/file.py#cl-10-20\\
which would link to line 10 and highlight lines 10 through 20. [GitHub example|https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/master/lib/puppet/module.rb#L42-54]

This is an extension of issues BCLOUD-8760 and BCLOUD-444
fields.summary: url link to multiple lines with #cl-XX-YY (BB-11586)

fields.description:
Using the file macro I can link from a wiki to a binary in the downloads section (eg <<file ../../downloads/somefile.pdf>> ).

However this results in a link that displays the relative path as well as the file name.\\
I'd like to be able to provide an alternate filename to display something more cleanly (eg <<file ../../downloads/somefile.pdf | Install Guide>> )
fields.summary: Enhance Creole file macro to support alternate name

fields.description:
I can't login myself in firfox 33.0. It's say:

Forbidden\\
CSRF verification failed. Request aborted.\\
Please go back and try again.

I have seen, that this may indicate, that referer header isn't send, but\\
my configs for firefox are network.http.sendRefererHeader = 2,\\
which is "Send the Referer header when clicking on a link or loading an image." So it is unlikely to be a problem with referrer header or require some not trivial config changes in browser configuration. In both cases please don't change the status to "won't fix", otherwise i will be forced to go to github, which work with my main browser and my privacy configuration  without problems.
fields.summary: Login issues in Firfox: 403 "CSRF verification failed. Request aborted."

fields.description: When replying to a comment via email, the email "noise" (the content of the original email, which is already in the comment thread) is automatically sucked into the reply.  I think a filter that would cut that out would really enhance this feature.
fields.summary: Commit Commenting via Email "Noisy"

fields.description:
All the navigation for issues pages is located at the top of the main pane of the site, except for the link to the main Issues page, which is found only in the bottom part of the menu on the left.

This is somewhat confusing, and requires a lot of mouse movement.
fields.summary: Make the heading on top of Issues pages link to the issue list (BB-11585)

fields.description:
Hello,

I just did few commits, my repository is private and only I have acess to this, but If I do commit, than It say Author of commit is Jakub Dobrý and that is not my account.\\
You can check it out here. https://bitbucket.org/Franta002/economy/commits/all

Can you tell me where is problem?\\
Thanks

fields.description:
ReStructuredText not rendered on overview page, instead the grey literal text box with the contents of README.rst is displayed. I am able to use the "Edit README" button to edit README.rst and the preview is correctly rendered. On the source page, README.rst is rendered.

(Issue noticed on a private repository.)
fields.summary: ReStructuredText not rendered on overview page

fields.description:
I've been using bitbucket actively for a short while now, and I've noticed that the pull request model bitbucket provides doesn't really work since you don't get relevant notifications.  You either get way too many, or essentially none.

In particular, if you're a reviewer on a pull request, and are watching it (the default), then you get a mail every time somebody pushes a commit to that PR, and every time somebody comments.  However, I'm really only interested in responses to my review notes. If I'm reviewing and writing several PR's, the amount of notifications is entirely unmanageable; there's no real choice but to ignore notifications entirely.

I can't reasonably unwatch because I'm automatically added as watcher whenever I comment, so I'd need to do this continually.
fields.summary: More granular pull request notification settings

fields.description:
Hi,

I am working on https://bitbucket.org/2xubucket/2xu/branch/US/pre_us I am committing to the above branch using windows mercury git and getting the issue as error: packfile .git/objects/pack/pack-b5923d124e67604e327708530782ec1029f30e14.pack does not match index warning: packfile .git/objects/pack/pack-b5923d124e67604e327708530782ec1029f30e14.pack cannot be accessed error: packfile .git/objects/pack/pack-b5923d124e67604e327708530782ec1029f30e14.pack does not match index warning: packfile .git/objects/pack/pack-b5923d124e67604e327708530782ec1029f30e14.pack cannot be accessed fatal: unable to read tree d8778d6f75e62895321be3de85cbe88449fe2dc2 Can you please look into this issue as it is quite urgent for me to commit code in this branch
fields.summary: Issue in https://bitbucket.org/2xubucket/2xu/branch/US/pre_us

and\\

fields.description:
I found a bug in bitbucket.\\
If you change your name, then your repositories are migrated to the new namespace, however the “repositories” menu bar still lists the old urls.\\
For example, I changed my user name. The Repositories dropdown box still shows the old name, and gives a 404 whenever I try and click on them. This continues until I log out of Bitbucket.
fields.summary: When a user changes username, the Nav Menu presents links with the old username. (BB-11573)

fields.description:
It seems like  "require:" breaks syntax lighlighting:

!3885273028-bb_bug.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "require:" breaks js syntax highlighting (BB-11574)

fields.description:
Since today, when I edit an issue I always get "major bug etc." selected which is not what the actual values of the issue were. If I then save the issue all these wrong selections are saved too of course.

Very annoying issue...
fields.summary: Issue attributes are reset to default in edit mode (BB-11572)

fields.description:
With the new ignore whitespace feature (see https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/6024/ability-to-ignore-whitespace-changes-in), files report themselves to have no change. Instead of showing a diff it shows "File contents unchanged." Attached is an image of the message.

Really, contents were changed, but it was only whitespace that changed. This can be misleading, especially for files where whitespace changes are important (ruby files, binary files, etc.). I know this from experience because of what happened that instigated https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/10109/according-to-pull-request-file-contents.
fields.summary: Files report themselves to have no change when only whitespace was changed and ?w=1 (BB-11571)

fields.description:
We're using the API endpoint to list files in a repo at a specific branch:

https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/{owner}/{reponame}/directory/{branch}

Recently it started acting weird when a branch name containing forward slashes is passed to it. We tried both passing the branch name as is (that returns a 404) or with the branch name url-encoded (that gives us an odd 401):

GET https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/jbpros/cucumber-pro-test/directory/master => 200\\
GET https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/jbpros/cucumber-pro-test/directory/path-like%2Fbranch%2Fname => 401\\
GET https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/jbpros/cucumber-pro-test/directory/path-like/branch/name => 404

Is there something we're missing or is there something broken on your end?
fields.summary: API can't list files in branches with a / in the name
Add support for PlantUML diagrams in README (BB-11569)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
I have a repository for a client, with an open issue tracker. They have created their own logins so that they can submit new issues. However, when I respond to an issue with a comment and they get the email notification of that comment, they are unable to respond via email and have it post as a comment on the issue. Instead they have to go to the issue to post a comment.

Hope this is an easy one.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add issue comment by email not working
Textile syntax highlighting (BB-11570)

fields.description:
It would be nice if the Bitbucket website could add [apple-touch-icons|https://developer.apple.com/library/iad/documentation/AppleApplications/Reference/SafariWebContent/ConfiguringWebApplications/ConfiguringWebApplications.html] to the HTML.

They're used to provide a larger icon for favorites in Safari on iOS and Yosemite, as well as an icon if the site is added to the home screen on iOS.
fields.summary: Add apple-touch-icons (BB-11565)

fields.description:
I would like someway of searching within the source of a given project.

People on one of my projects are a little used to that feature from github, but I would rather use just one place for all repositories I manage and most of my projects already use BitBucket.
fields.summary: project source searching

fields.description:
[I know this has been asked a lot of times|http://www.google.com/search%3Fq%3Dssh%253A%2520connect%2520to%2520host%2520bitbucket.org%2520port%252022%253A%2520Connection%2520refused].

In my case it only stopped working now, as it was working fine just a moment ago.

I've tried  switching to 443 port which gives me the error

bq. {code}
ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
{code}


I'm accessing through cloud9. Locally it works. Github works both locally and on cloud9.

Also just before it stopped working, I may have made a lot of pull requests instantaneously, could it be that my (cloud9) IP was added to a reject list?
fields.summary: ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Connection refused

fields.description:
We're failing to bail out early and serve the history node page for individual files because of a timeout computing the DAG, when we should just show the page without the grey branch labels for repositories with thousands of refs.

We've created an internal issue to start by capping the amount of time we are willing to burn on computing this data synchronously at request time and just serve the page without the labels if we exceed that.
fields.summary: Fail branch label computation for history view gracefully (BB-11563)

fields.description:
Hi, like many others here, I signed up for a new account. Upon completion, I got this message:\\
Your account has been disabled.\\
We're sorry. Your account has been flagged by our automated system for possible violation of our terms of service. If this is an error, please contact Bitbucket Support to have it reinstated.\\
My username is fcac89, thank you for helping me resolve this.
fields.summary: account has been disabled

fields.description:
This issue has nothing to do with BCLOUD-6024 and BCLOUD-3812. Because it is not related to diff viewer, rather it is related to providing an option while merging. Though it is not duplicate of BCLOUD-6024 and BCLOUD-3812, hopefully it should still provide workaround for those.

Provide options (checkboxes) for ignoring white-space characters on merge screen (https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/branch/develop?dest=master) and pull-request screen (https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/pull-request/new?source=user/repo%3A%3Adevelop&dest=user/repo%3A%3Amaster). Basically, option for {{git merge -Xignore-space-change}} and/or {{git merge -Xignore-all-space}}

*Steps to reproduce*

# Make changes in two different branches in a way that it creates conflicts (white-space conflicts only)
# Try to merge one into other (https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/branch/develop?dest=master)

*Actual result:*\\
It can't merge due to white-space conflicts

*Expected result:*\\
It should allow to ignore white-space conflicts

Same applies for pull-requests.
fields.summary: Option to ignore white-space while merging branches

fields.description:
Hi,

When I try to log in I get the message: "Your account has been deactivated. Please contact Bitbucket Support for assistance.".

My username is: oscarsc88. Thank you for helping me resolve this.
fields.summary: Your account has been deactivated.

fields.description:
In a pull request files that are moved or renamed are shown as two files. That makes a review very confusing and the developer doesn't do refactorings to better the code quality because it makes everything a mess for the reviewer.

Also don't  show the whole content of a deleted file. If a whole file is deleted it seldom is necessary to look at it`s content (Add a button to only show it on request).
fields.summary: Pull Requests - Clearly show moved files

fields.description:
Hi

I have hooks in several repos to POST commits to a slack.com channel. Works fine when there's only one commit per push to the Bitbucket repo. However when there are more than one commit to same branch in repo, the POST data do not include any branch information.\\
Acceptable for slack.com, but for instance it causes my CI server to not fire tests.

I have seen similar but not identical issue reports where only the last of a set of commits would have branch information. I don't see any branch at all.\\
In addition, you answer in https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8021/post-hook-missing-branch-name-on-push-with or https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/6388/post-only-returning-the-branch-of-the-last that missing branch info in POST data is normal, coming from git behavior.\\
How are systems on the receiving end (such as slack, for which you have an integration) supposed to figure out the branch?\\
Again, my situation is different as I don't have ANY branch info in case of multiple commits.

Thanks and regards
fields.summary: POST hook to slack (and others) don't include any branch information in case of multiple commits (BB-11539)

fields.description:
It would be great to have hooks at a team level, so that all repositories that are created have the same hooks automatically.

Currently for every repository we have to add the same hook (in this case pivitol tracker, with the same token), otherwise the integration breaks.
fields.summary: Team Hooks

fields.description:
Hi, when you upload the two files with same name (i.e. file.zip) to the download section and then delete the one, the other is deleted too (if you tried to download the second one, the missing link error occurs). I think this is because the second file with the same name overwrite the first file.

I think this could be solved with one of these:

# Disable the upload of the same file name twice
# Version the each file name appending some counter to the file name after upload
fields.summary: removal of project's downloads files with same name

fields.description:
When clicking "edit" on an existing deployment key, the field to modify the key itself is greyed out.\\
!http://i.imgur.com/3Ceh3Ee.png!\\
Clicking edit, one would expect to be able to alter the key itself, not just the name.
fields.summary: Unable to edit deployment keys

fields.description: I would like to be able to set a POST commit hook through the API, to automate creation of repositories for automated builds.  Currently you have to log into Bitbucket and set the POST commit hooks manually.
fields.summary: Set POST commit hook through API

fields.description:
Hi

fields.description: Grey out Merge button as long as any tasks are open. This won't prevent anyone wanting to merge from marking tasks as complete, but it will draw attention to the fact that there are outstanding tasks.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I'd like the option to disable the merge option if any tasks are not marked complete (BB-11532)

fields.description:
Currently, when PR contains a change in submodules, only the commit message is shown (and when viewing the raw commit, the changed hash)

To make PR view helpful with submodules, the Bitbucket should show the visual diff - as it does with the local repository.

{code}
#!text

From 138f81ed1671507e31c4263127d2a07a0c7c8573 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Juha Mustonen <juha.mustonen@company.com>
Date: Fri, 7 Nov 2014 10:42:51 +0200
Subject: [PATCH] Update foo package: Fix unit testing

---
 packages/foo | 2 +-
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)

diff --git a/packages/foo b/packages/foo
index 68fb3a4..ce35130 160000
--- a/packages/foo
+++ b/packages/foo
@@ -1 +1 @@
-Subproject commit 68fb3a43e9f88c23f0a3ca8a058a0f436d6e5566
+Subproject commit ce351306c7e28d261a3e7c0c5ace3966c1a8f1fd
-- 
2.1.1
{code}
fields.summary: Show visual diff also for submodules (BB-11535)

fields.description:
We really love bitbucket and use it for almost all our git repositories.\\
But here come's the problem. We have our main project divided into several repositories. In our case, the main repositories are the server side java app, offering JSON API, and the second repository for in browser SPA application, which consume the app. A lot of features are maintained in both repositories. The issue is, that when some pullrequest is created, we can't see from the e-mail, for which repository it is. To get this knowledge, we need to open it in browser.

It is really a small issue, not so important. We live without it until now and we will farthest. I just want you to know about it .

P.S.: Sorry for my english .
fields.summary: Project name in pull request notification. (BB-11533)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I can compare two branches and see the files which are different. But is there a way that i can see the difference in contents and merge only the required contents to branches. There is Branch A and B and people are parallel y working, at some point of time some part of code we need to merge. Is it possible to compare and merge the file contents.
fields.summary: Find Difference in Branch Files and merge only the required changes

fields.description:
I have sometimes contributed to https://bitbucket.org/galaxy/galaxy-central/

I already have my own fork, https://bitbucket.org/peterjc/galaxy-central/

*Steps to reproduce*

# Logged into BitBucket as peterjc
# Browsed to https://bitbucket.org/galaxy/galaxy-central/src/4f8bee770d0be3f13cb7d2283a288c588b54ad63/lib/galaxy/tools/test.py?at=default - i.e. latest revision of file {{lib/galaxy/tools/test.py}}
# Clicked edit
# Corrected typo nothting [sic] in test exception
# Clicked commit
# Long delay while the repository was forked, an automatically named branch created, resulting in this pull request: https://bitbucket.org/galaxy/galaxy-central/pull-request/553

*Expected result:*

New branch would be under my existing repository, https://bitbucket.org/peterjc/galaxy-central/ (perhaps using GitHub style naming of the branch as {{patch-1}}, {{patch-2}}, etc).

*Actual result:*

Duplicated repository https://bitbucket.org/peterjc/galaxy-central-1 created with awkwardly long new branch {{fix-typo-nothting-sic-in-test-exception-1415290865597}} - see https://bitbucket.org/peterjc/galaxy-central-1/branch/peterjc/fix-typo-nothting-sic-in-test-exception-1415290865597
fields.summary: Editing file via website made second fork of my repository

fields.description:
When I see pull request to my repo I don't actually know whether it was rebased (sync) to the head of my repo.\\
So I think I would be great to see this information somewhere in pull request title.\\
The next step is the ability for me (as repo owner) to sync outdated pull request to avoid "merge hell"

fields.description:
Hi there,

Would it be possible to amend the list of a team's e-mail addresses?

At present we only have one individual as "primary" email address, but want to add a "secondary" email address. Is that possible?

Thanks
fields.summary: Add option to update a team's e-mail address

fields.description:
We're having a lot of issues at the moment caused of case differences in branches. Basically, because Windows file systems do not differentiate between case, but the *nix ones do, quite a lot of the time people will end up pushing the same branch but with a differently cased name. This causes problems when Windows users then try and fetch as Git starts moaning that commits don't match etc.

As simple fix for this could be achieved using a pre-receive hook that effectively checked whether or not this push would create a new branch, and then to confirm that the name of the branch doesn't already exist but with a differently cased name.

Obviously this is only really relevant to people with a mix of different users on different operating systems, but it would resolve so many headaches for me!
fields.summary: Add ability to prevent creation of branches with the same name but different case

fields.description:
From a support issue:

How about providing a "project warnings page"? It would show the\\

fields.description:
Will we see syntax highlighting when viewing a commit diff or pull request in the future?

Having syntax highlighting would be far easier to read and could improve the rate of churning out peer reviews.
fields.summary: Syntax Highlighting (BB-11503)

fields.description:
For Mercurial repositories, there is a "strip changesets" page under Settings. You enter a revision number and it shows you a confirmation page with a "Confirm strip" button. Used to, pressing "Confirm strip" would take you to an HTML page containing an offer to download an archive of the stripped changesets. However, I tried it several times just now, and in all cases clicking "Confirm strip" instead took me to a plain white page containing a large, unformatted JSON blob. The strip completed correctly, but I was not shown a page indicating the operation was successful.

This is on Chrome 38.0.2125.111 on OS X 10.6. I got a screenshot which I would be happy to show to an Atlassian employee, but I would rather not post it to a public bug tracker because I do not know if the JSON blob contains sensitive information about my account.
fields.summary: hg strip displays raw JSON instead of success page (BB-11529)
images not appearing in export zip (BB-11504)

fields.description:
Here are the workflow:

# Added readonly access level account in my repositroy,
# Then the readonly account forked my repository,
# He did as following command:

{code}
#!git

Fork     repository: https://Edison@bitbucket.org/Edison/testrepository.git
readonly repository: https://Edward@bitbucket.org/Edward/testrepository.git
<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
git clone https://Edison@bitbucket.org/Edison/testrepository.git
git remote add edward https://Edward@bitbucket.org/Edward/testrepository.git
// edited README file
git add README
git commit
git push edward master
Password for 'https://Edward@bitbucket.org':
Counting objects: 8, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (4/4), done.
Writing objects: 100% (6/6), 566 bytes | 0 bytes/s, done.
Total 6 (delta 2), reused 0 (delta 0)
To https://Edward@bitbucket.org/Edward/testrepository.git
   2fbffbb..0be0576  master -> master
{code}

*Question: why could he push to my repositroy with his readonly access right ?*\\
*It is a bug or a normal case ? Many thanks for helping me.*
fields.summary: Why repository could also be pushed by readonly access level account ?

fields.description:
I have logged this via email, and via an account linked to the repository in question too, but getting no response. I realise this may be due to it being a weird time and you may have no support engineers working (which is a tad disappointing for a paid service), but I have to work because I have to hit a release deadline for Monday! So I'm desperately trying to get help from wherever I can...

The repository in question is https://bitbucket.org/odokoltd/unleashed - it has been running at over 1Gb for a week or so because I had to check in some binary files to satisfy a customer who uses the repository to get access to the materials we maintain for them.

However, having completed writing some distribution scripts that negate the need for those files to be checked in to the repository, I started following the instructions from Option 1) below, in order to remove the offending large binaries and try and resolve the "over 1Gb" issue:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Maintaining+a+Git+Repository

But far from resolving the issue, this seems to have pushed the repository from 1Gb to over 2Gb. WTF? And apparently this means the repository is now completely unuseable too! That's nothing short of disastrous, given it's how we maintain a client relationship...

The local repository on my system is now just 300Mb. Is there a way I can get access back to our Bitbucket origin in order to push up my local git repo'? I 'think' if I am able to run git push --all --force all should be well. At least I hope, because I don't really understand how following YOUR instructions and trying to remove the large files has caused this issue in the first place!
fields.summary: 2GB repository

fields.description: I'm migrating an application that gets information from pull requests using the API. I'm wondering if I can get pull requests filtered by destination branch name. The only filter I can use right now is by state.
fields.summary: As a developer, I would like an API endpoint for Pullrequest(s) by branch name (BB-11488)
Pull Requests Diffs for Objective-C extension files that include '+' don't work

fields.description:
Hi all,

I would love to see an autocomplete for JIRA issues in the title when creating a new Pull Request. I get the ids wrong quite often, and having a autocomplete for issues (with the key and title displayed) would save us quite some time.
fields.summary: Autocomplete for JIRA issues in pull request form (BB-11485)
